article.headline: Portland 73, Pepperdine 58
article.story: MALIBU, Calif. -- Nik Ravio had 20 points and nine rebounds to help Portland win its fourth straight game by beating Pepperdine 73-58 on Saturday. The Pilots raced out to a 12-2 lead and never trailed again. T.J. Campbell scored 11 points and Jared Stohl added 13 for Portland (13-7, 4-1 West Coast Conference), which made eight 3-pointers. Taylor Darby scored all of his 12 points in the second half and Keion Bell also had 12 to lead Pepperdine (4-17, 1-4). The Waves made just 2-of-13 3-point attempts during their fourth straight loss. After Pepperdine trimmed Portland's lead to 21-18 when Mychel Thompson scored on a layup with 8:28 before halftime, the Waves offense disappeared. Portland then out-scored Pepperdine 23-5 for a 44-23 lead at the break.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
